Quotes: I can make more generals, but horses cost money.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: These men ask for just the same thing, fairness, and fairness only. This, so far as in my power, they, and all others, shall have.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: The society based on production is only productive, not creative.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: You can never solve a problem on the level on which it was created.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Science is a wonderful thing if one does not have to earn one's living at it.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: To imagine is everything, to know is nothing at all.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: All paid jobs absorb and degrade the mind.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: He who is to be a good ruler must have first been ruled.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: Industry need not wish.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: No nation was ever ruined by trade.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: Wealth is not his that has it, but his that enjoys it.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: The one great principle of English law is to make business for itself.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Never go to excess, but let moderation be your guide.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: If you think in terms of a year, plant a seed;if in terms of ten years, plant trees;if in terms of 100 years, teach the people.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Sperm is a bandit in its pure state.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Glory - once achieved, what is it worth?
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: He is not to pass for a man of reason who stumbles upon reason by chance but he who knows it and can judge it and has a true taste for it.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Nothing is ever done in this world until men are prepared to kill one another if it is not done.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The only secrets are the secrets that keep themselves.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: One man that has a mind and knows it can always beat ten men who haven't and don't.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Do not try to live forever. You will not succeed.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: The first condition of progress is the removal of censorship.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Rome - the city of visible history, where the past of a whole hemisphere seems moving in funeral procession with strange ancestral images and trophies gathered from afar.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Whoever is winning at the moment will always seem to be invincible.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: I worked my way up from nothing to a state of extreme poverty.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Before everything else, getting ready is the secret of success.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Don't find fault, find a remedy.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar, instead of how little he can give for a dollar, is bound to succeed.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: It is not the employer who pays the wages. Employers only handle the money. It is the customer who pays the wages.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Power is not revealed by striking hard or often, but by striking true.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: The person who has lived the most is not the one with the most years but the one with the richest experiences.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: I have always said and felt that true enjoyment can not be described.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: When something an affliction happens to you, you either let it defeat you, or you defeat it.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: He who does not think much of himself is much more esteemed than he imagines.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: He is happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: In the realm of ideas everything depends on enthusiasm... in the real world all rests on perseverance.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: When angry, count to four;when very angry, swear.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Buy land, they're not making it anymore.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Prosperity is the best protector of principle.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: It is double pleasure to deceive the deceiver.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Everybody who is incapable of learning has taken to teaching.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I have the simplest tastes. I am always satisfied with the best.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: It is better to have a permanent income than to be fascinating.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Perhaps, after all, America never has been discovered. I myself would say that it had merely been detected.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: When you are enthusiastic about what you do, you feel this positive energy. It's very simple.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Touch a scientist and you touch a child.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: But when ill indeed, Even dismissing the doctor don't always succeed.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: I am an intelligent river which has reflected successively all the banks before which it has flowed by meditating only on the images offered by those changing shores.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: It is better to risk saving a guilty man than to condemn an innocent one.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: You're dead if you aim only for kids. Adults are only kids grown up, anyway.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: I do not like to repeat successes, I like to go on to other things.
Author: Walt Disney
